result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M. Oramous was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua M. Oramous

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant called and stated he had sent out check and envelope with check was returned to him.  Defendant will either stop in or try to re-mail it.

3:31 p.m. Defendant Joshua M. Oramous in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm423 and 15cm469. Defendant states he spoke with District Attorney and agreement is to plead no contest to one case and other would be dropped.  Schiek states no notes in file-Defendant requested counsel after offer was made - Schiek statement - victim rights legislation complied with. State moves to dismiss 15cm469- Granted. Defendant wishes to have record expunged if he pleads no contest. Court states expungement not available. Defendant pleads guilty in 15cm423. Right to counsel reiterated - defendant wishes to proceed on own - Waiver free and voluntary. Defendant changes plea to no contest.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Recess.
On record 3:53 p.m.  Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
WHS/POP - 9 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
AODA assessment and follow-through
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Anger management counseling is encouraged.
Jail credit - 1 day
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 3:58 p.m.

2:47 p.m. Defendant Joshua M. Oramous in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm423 and 15cm469. Defendant states spoke with DA's office - wants to hire Cirilli but needs time to obtain funds for retainer - defendant believes he makes too much money for public defender appointment. Court enters not guilty pleas on defendant's behalf. Court statement to jury trial will be scheduled if not resolved by next date. Adj. 2:51 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:06 p.m. Defendant Joshua M. Oramous in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm423 and 15cm469. Defendant states that he is not eligible for public defendant - he spoke with an attorney re domestic abuse charge - was advised to contact DA on that charge - on bail jumping charge - wants to seek counsel. Court grants one additional adjournment - but cautions defendant he needs to be prepared to go forward at next hearing. Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 3:12 p.m.

3:02 p.m. Defendant Joshua M. Oramous in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant as to adhering to conditions of bond - Defendant states he has been in compliance.  Michlig statement to new charges filed last week.  Court questions defendant as to new charges - Defendant states his court date was supposed to be 11/13/15 but date was changed and he is unsure of new date.   Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm to track with 15cm469. Court directs defendant to PD's office. Bail continued. Adj. 3:07 p.m.
No intoxicants; no taverns; no contact with victim
No contact with victims - No intoxicants; no taverns

1:50 p.m. Defendant Joshua M. Oramous in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Michlig/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
